words.definition: To bring means to take someone or something to a person or place.
words.example: Oscar will bring in all the boxes.

words.definition: A castle is a building with strong walls where royalty usually lives.
words.example: The castle was built many years ago.

words.definition: To command someone is to tell them to do something.
words.example: The general commanded his army to attack.

words.definition: To counsel someone is to listen and give advice about a problem.
words.example: The teacher counseled the girl about her troubles.

words.definition: To ensure is to make certain that something happens.
words.example: Eating good food helps ensure good health.

words.definition: An explosion is a violent burst, usually with a loud sound.
words.example: A nuclear explosion can cause great damage.

words.definition: Jewelry is something that people wear like earrings or necklaces.
words.example: The woman looked beautiful with her nice jewelry.

words.definition: To land means to come to the ground usually from a ship or aircraft.
words.example: The airplane will land in Tokyo at six in the morning.

words.definition: A meteor is a rock from outer space that falls to Earth.
words.example: We saw a meteor in the sky last night.

words.definition: A monster is any imaginary frightening creature.
words.example: The monster scared everyone in the village.

words.definition: If something is northern, it is in the direction of north.
words.example: It is much colder in northern countries than it is here.

words.definition: If something is remote, it is very far away and difficult to get to.
words.example: It took many days to get to the remote village.

words.definition: If something is southern, it is in the direction of south.
words.example: Taegu is in the southern part of Korea.

words.definition: A statue is an image of a person or animal made of stone or metal.
words.example: I saw a beautiful statue of a lion today.

words.definition: Steam is water that has become hot and has turned into a misty gas.
words.example: We could see the steam rising from the boiling water.

words.definition: To submit of a person is to agree to do what they tell you to do.
words.example: She submitted to her mother’s wishes for her to stay home.

words.definition: A temple is a building that is used for religious purposes.
words.example: The people visited the temple to pray.

words.definition: Upper means higher in position or status.
words.example: A home’s upper floor is usually where the bedrooms are.

words.definition: A weed is a plant that is not useful and grows where it is not wanted.
words.example: The garden of the house was full of weeds.

words.definition: A wing is the part of an animal that lets it fly.
words.example: The bird used its wings to fly high in the sky.
